pullrequest.title: Test loading all example config files

content.raw:
Actually, renaming the files was just a left over from pull request #28.

Yeah the `hello_plugin` is an example plugin and so it is not installed with Ignition GUI. It's a good point that it shouldn't be in the example configurations then, I'll change that.

Right now, `loadConfig` is only failing if there's something wrong with the `.config` file itself (it doesn't exist, malformed XML, etc). If a plugin is invalid, the configuration will still be loaded and return a success, but the user sees an error message. It would be trivial to return false if at least one plugin failed to load, but I'm not entirely convinced that is what "failing to load config" should mean. In any case, I guess this should be documented.
content.html:
Actually, renaming the files was just a left over from pull request #28.

Yeah the hello_plugin is an example plugin and so it is not installed with Ignition GUI. It's a good point that it shouldn't be in the example configurations then, I'll change that.

Right now, loadConfig is only failing if there's something wrong with the .config file itself (it doesn't exist, malformed XML, etc). If a plugin is invalid, the configuration will still be loaded and return a success, but the user sees an error message. It would be trivial to return false if at least one plugin failed to load, but I'm not entirely convinced that is what "failing to load config" should mean. In any case, I guess this should be documented.
